src:
Machín: “Fem moltes coses bé, però el premi no arriba”
El tècnic lamenta haver perdut un partit que tenien "controlat perfectament" al primer temps

02 Nov 2019, 14:46

"Hem fet una primera part excel·lent, però tenen un gran potencial i a la segona havien de fer alguna cosa més amb el partit en contra. No hem anat enrere, hem seguit el mateix pla, però els seus bons jugadors han aparegut, i el penal, per com ha estat i per l'estat en què estem, ens ha afectat més". Així ha resumit Pablo Machín la derrota del seu Espanyol contra el València. El tècnic ha lamentat la segona part del seu equip, on ha reconegut que ha tingut "cor, però no gaire joc". "Les coses bones que hem fet avui serveixen de poc o es tapen per la derrota. Fem coses bé, però el premi no arriba", ha afirmat el tècnic, capcot. 
Machín ha assegurat que el seu equip pateix "un cúmul de coses, no només un tema mental". "Tot i això, potser pel sentiment d'injustícia de rebre un segon gol quan havíem fet coses bé, fa que et puguis frustrar una mica", ha afegit el tècnic, que ha deixat clar que aquest és el moment on "han de sortir els jugadors i el seu talent". Per al tècnic espanyolista, el València s'ha endut el partit perquè "ha tingut l'encert als metres finals" que al seu equip li ha faltat. 
El preparador de Sòria ha tret pit de la primera part que ha fet el seu conjunt, que al seu criteri ha "controlat perfectament" el València. Tot ha canviat arran d'un penal que ha qualificat com a " light", que ha portat que la moral de l'Espanyol anés "cap avall" i la del València "cap amunt". "Hem tingut pocs arguments des de la qualitat, hem tirat més de coratge", ha exposat. El tècnic també ha destacat el bon paper que ha tingut Wu Lei. "Ha estat un jugador amb molta velocitat, l’hem volgut explotar. La condició física no és la millor per aguantar 90 minuts. S’ha vist que vol velocitat, quan se li expliquen les coses és molt disciplinat".
text:
Machín: "We do many good things, but the prize does not arrive"
The technician regrets having lost a game that they had "controlled perfectly" in the first half

02 Nov 2019, 14:46

"We did a great first, but they have a great potential and the second had to do something else with the game against. We have not gone back, we have followed the same plan, but their good players have appeared, and the penalty, for how it has been and for the state in which we are, has affected us more ". This is how Pablo Machín summed up his Spanish defeat against Valencia. The coach lamented the second part of his team, where he acknowledged that he had "heart, but not much game". "The good things that we have done today serve little or stop by the defeat. We do things right, but the prize does not arrive," said the coach, capcot.
Machín assured that his team suffers "a cluster of things, not just a mental issue". "Even so, perhaps because of the feeling of injustice of receiving a second goal when we had done things right, it makes you feel frustrated a little", added the technician, who made it clear that this is the moment they "have to leave the players and their talent ". For the Spanish nationalist, Valencia took the game because "he was right in the final stages" that his team has missed.
The coach of Soria has taken off from the first part that made his set, which in his opinion has "controlled perfectly" Valencia. Everything has changed as a result of a penalty that he described as a "light", which led to the Spanish morale being "down" and that of Valencia "up". "We have had few arguments from the quality, we have drawn more courage," he said. The technician also highlighted the good role that Wu Lei has had. "He was a very fast player, we wanted to exploit him. The physical condition is not the best to endure for 90 minutes. He has seen that he wants speed, when he is told things is very disciplined."
